page.title: 02The Waveney Valley
page.content:
The Views In Alburgh
The flat land falls to the marshes and river of the Waveney. Apart from occasional wooded areas the landscape is one of large fields interspersed by hedges in which rises the occasional fully grown tree. Many hedges have been removed in the cause of progress though around the school, where, until recently dairying was carried out the fields are small with many tall hedges surrounding them. This farm, not for sale, must I am sure follow the pattern of others and hedges make way for large machinery and cereal crops. In the valley it is proposed to build a new bypass along the old railway track to take traffic from the village of Wortwell.
